docs.lead_paragraph: It’s been 13 months since I started writing about my business, and I’ve posted 60 times since then. I’ve been asked by many people how I got involved with “You’re the Boss.” The short answer: good timing and luck.
docs.abstract: The blogger Paul Downs discusses his experiences creating and writing this blog and what he has learned along the way.

docs.lead_paragraph: HIGH-SPEED METAPHOR Bart Chilton, below, a Democratic member of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, fears that cheetahs are running wild on Wall Street. Mr. Chilton was referring to high-frequency traders, a group he nicknamed cheetahs because of their speed and fearless nature. ''We need to do a better job of keeping up with the cheetahs and the ramifications of technology in the financial sector in general,'' he told a conference of high-frequency traders in Amsterdam on Wednesday. BEN PROTESS
docs.abstract: DealBook Online; Commodity Futures Trading Commission member Bart Chilton warns against high-frequency traders; private equity executives Joshua Harris and David Blitzer are attempting to buy Philadelphia 76ers; effort by Michael Migliozzi II and Brian William Flatow to buy Pabst Brewing Co has failed; WellPoint agrees to buy CareMore for $800 million; photos (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Leo Rangell, a leading psychoanalyst during the heyday of classical Freudian talk therapy in the 1960s and '70s, and a relentless advocate for the slow approach to treating emotional distress even as antidepressants and managed care made short-term treatment the norm, died on May 28 in Los Angeles. He was 97. His family said the cause was complications of a surgical procedure the day before at the U.C.L.A. Medical Center.

headline.main: Leo Rangell, 97, Leading Freudian Psychoanalyst, Dies

docs.abstract: Dr Leo Rangell, a leading psychoanalyst during the Freudian talk therapy days of the 1960s and 1970s, dies at age 97. Photo (M)
